primair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The transition from the 'equality of nothingness' (death) to the 'eternity of difference' (life) through the personal encounter with the Risen Christ.

tekstueel_bewijs: He cast seven devils out of her poor, storm-swept soul.
The voice which spoke... healed the woman... stilled the storm.
What is there that gives meaning to this crazy quilt we call life?
If a man die, shall he live again?
a cry in the direction of God, 'Father, forgive them'
deeper depth of the love and power of God

ontvanger.identificatie: Mary Magdalene (and by extension, the Hearer/Church)
tekstueel_bewijs: Mary answered, and the stone rolled away from her poor, sorrowing heart.
Someone here got through school because a teacher somewhere kept coming back.
ontvanger.positie_hoorder: The hearer identifies with the Receiver (the one being called).

helper.identificatie: Love (as a persistent force) and the Angels
tekstueel_bewijs: Love is such a stubborn, determined thing propelling us.
The eyes of the angels alerted her that someone else was near.
helper.rol_van_god: God is the Subject/Initiator; Love is the instrumental force.

tekstueel_bewijs: The doctrines of Karl Marx and the communist philosophy.
tegenstander.toelichting_ernst: The opponent is not just bad behavior but the ontological threat of 'nothingness' and the 'midday midnight' of the crucifixion.

secundair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The persistence of human love and the church's witness in the face of apparent failure.
secundair_narratief_programma.subject: The Church (Mothers, Teachers, Preachers, Deacons)
secundair_narratief_programma.object: Persistence in faith/service despite the 'empty tomb' of results.
secundair_narratief_programma.toelichting_verhouding: Human persistence is presented as a reflection of the 'stubborn love' that leads to the encounter with the Risen Lord.

voorbeelden_god_subject: Jesus says that he knoweth his sheep by name.
voorbeelden_mens_subject: Mary Magdalene makes her quiet and reverent way.

voorbeelden: She would know that voice anywhere.
Not one of them can make us voluntarily get up.
Life can be forever different only when the Lord's voice has spoken.

modale_analyse.modale_interpretatie: The sermon focuses on the 'Power' (Pouvoir) of the Resurrection to break the 'Nothingness' that human 'Logic' or 'Common Sense' cannot overcome.

semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.beweging_in_preek: From S2 (Death/Friday) to ~S2 (Persistence/Love) to S1 (The Risen Voice).
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.theologische_resolutie: The tension is resolved not by human discovery, but by the 'Voice' of the Subject (Jesus) breaking into the silence.
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.ernst_van_s2: High; death is described as 'cold, chill heaviness' and 'midday midnight'.

diagnostische_evaluatie.classificatie_toelichting: While the sermon highlights human love, it ultimately grounds the transformation of the heart in the active 'calling' of Jesus. The hearer is the receiver of a voice, not the achiever of a state.

indicatoren_moralisme.tekstueel_bewijs: Someone here got through school because a teacher somewhere kept coming back.

indicatoren_genade.indicator: God as the active Subject of restoration
indicatoren_genade.tekstueel_bewijs: The stone rolled away from her poor, sorrowing heart.

exemplarisme_check.beschrijving: Mary's love and the persistence of parents/teachers are used as analogies for the 'stubborn love' of God.
exemplarisme_check.alternatieve_lezing: The sermon already pivots to theocentricity by noting that Mary's love was 'pathetic' and 'unmindful of practicality' until Jesus spoke.

identificatie_patroon.effect_op_hoorder: Consolation and awe; a sense of being known personally by God.
identificatie_patroon.theologische_implicatie: Soteriology is monergistic in the moment of 'calling'.

narratieve_coherentie.coherentie_beschrijving: The transition from the cosmic 'news story' to the personal 'calling of the name' is seamless.
spanning_punten: The tension between human love's persistence and its actual inability to 'carry the body' without the Resurrection.

soteriologie.tekstueel_bewijs: The church continues to march on... still salvation's story is being told.

pneumatologie.competentie_schenking: The 'Voice' functions as the means of grace/power.

hamartologie.ernst_diagnose: Sin is seen as 'seven devils' and 'storm-swept souls'—powers that require exorcism/resurrection.

aanbevelingen.actantiele_audit_samenvatting: The sermon successfully maintains God/Jesus as the primary Subject of the 'Performance' phase (the Resurrection and the Calling).

identificatie_herstel.strategie: Maintain the focus on the 'Voice' reaching the hearer.

modale_balans.voorgestelde_balans: Slightly more Savoir (the content of the 'Master's' teaching).
modale_balans.concrete_suggestie: Briefly connect the 'Voice' to the specific promises of the Gospel.

tegenstander_intensivering.theologische_rationale: The sermon already treats death with appropriate gravity.

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: A masterclass in moving from the cosmic significance of the Resurrection to the intimate, actantial encounter between the Savior and the Soul.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retorische_analyse: Rhetorical analysis would focus on the 'musical' metaphors; Greimas shows these metaphors function as the 'Object' of value being transmitted.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_exegese: Exegesis explains the Greek of John 20; Greimas explains why the 'Voice' is the only actant capable of resolving the 'Nothingness' established in the introduction.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_greimas: Reveals that 'Love' is not the Subject of the sermon, but the 'Helper' that brings the Receiver to the place where the true Subject (Jesus) acts.

volledige_subject_lijst: Jesus (called, cast out, taught, healed, spoke, stilled)
Mary (makes way, discovers, runs, turns, answers)
volledige_object_lijst: The crazy quilt of life (given meaning)
appendices.notities: The sermon uses 'Love' as a semi-autonomous actant (Helper) which bridges the gap between human despair and divine intervention.
